Key Match Events: Roston Chase’s unbeaten 42 off 27 balls (four fours, two sixes) led West Indies to victory.
Andre Russell contributed 15 not out in the chase.
West Indies reached 137 for five off 19 overs.
Roston Chase and Andre Russell had an unbroken sixth-wicket partnership of 40 runs.
Roston Chase was named 'Man of the Match' for his all-round performance.
Sese Bau scored 50 off 43 balls for Papua New Guinea.
Alzarri Joseph and Andre Russell took two wickets each for West Indies.
Post-Match Reflections: Roston Chase reflected on his strategy to give himself time and back his skills.
Assad Vala mentioned that PNG was 10-15 runs short of a competitive target but was happy with the fight shown.
Rovman Powell acknowledged PNG's good cricket and emphasized the need for West Indies to improve in all departments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Papua New Guinea's total was 136 for eight in 20 overs.
West Indies chased down the target with an over to spare.
This was Papua New Guinea's second appearance in a world tournament.
